alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 4:38PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT ALPINE AND EL DORADO COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM PDT... At 434 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Lake Tahoe near Emerald Bay and through Hope Valley along HWY 88. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. Dime sized hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rain could lead to ponding of water on roadways and localized flooding in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... South Lake Tahoe, Bliss State Park, Emerald Bay, Meyers, Hope Valley, South Lake Tahoe Airport, Fallen Leaf Campground, Junction CA 88 W And CA 89 N (picketts Junction), and Luther Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
